name: Data Analyst (Client Squad)
description:
Dostavista Global - one of the biggest and most technologically advanced players in the global same-day delivery market. We deliver unparalleled convenience to businesses and people, all the while creating millions of jobs. More than 1 million couriers are registered on the platform in 11 countries. They deliver millions of parcels per year. In order to keep pace, we are constantly looking for ambitious professionals to join our team. Right now we are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Client product squad.

What you will do:

  • Provide analytical insight to help Client product team improve all aspects of client's interaction with the company, including web and mobile application;
  • Create an exhaustive view of client's user journey to identify growth points and generate hypotheses to improve client's experience;
  • Construct and monitor key metrics of client's experience, provide analysis of the client's behavior;
  • Develop dashboards and reports using BI tools;
  • Conduct A/B tests to improve relevant metrics;

What you already have:

  • 2+ years of experience in the field of Data Analytics/Product Analytics;
  • Proficiency with relational and analytical databases, strong knowledge of SQL;
  • Experience creating and managing reports in BI suites (preferably Tableau);
  • Attention to detail and accuracy;
  • Written English;

Ways to stand out:

  • Knowledge of mathematical statistics, experience with A/B testing;
  • Knowledge of Python for data analysis;
  • Experience with analytics of web/mobile services and applications, experience with Firebase/Amplitude analytics systems;

What do we offer:

  • Ability to work remotely (both partially and completely);
  • Equipment for work: laptop, additional monitor, headset, and so on;
  • Flexible schedule: we work at a convenient time, the main thing is to be in touch during the main working hours;
  • Horizontal structure without strict subordination and bureaucracy;
  • Official employment and salary;
  • The annual indexation of salaries and the feedback from the head;
  • Education: own library, paid courses and conferences.
